description:
In Felicidad, farmers known as the Farmagia raise monsters under the peaceful rule of the Magus Diluculum. After the Magus passes, a power struggle erupts among forces using monsters to seize control. In the town of Centvelt, Farmagia Ten and his friends band together against the despotic new ruler, Glaza. Ten, his friends, and their home-grown monsters must stay strong to defend their freedom.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Horticulture
tags.description: The story prominently features plant care and gardening.

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiro_mashima)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQLYbIvGWtClestisnB1_6A)__

Japanese manga artist most known for his manga Groove Adventure Rave, published by Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine, from 1999 to 2005. The series was later adapted into an anime. However, the anime adaption was cancelled before it could complete the series.

In 2003, he collected some of his one-shot titles in two volumes: Mashima-en- Vol.1 & 2. Those stories include, among others, Cocona, "Xmas Hearts" and "Fairy Tail", a sort of prototype for his last work.

In 2006, he began his now finished series, Fairy Tail, serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine. He also published the manga Monster Hunter Orage.

Hiro Mashima was a notable guest at the 2008 San Diego Comic-Con. He has one daughter.

His artwork and [Oda Eiichiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/EiichiroOda)'s are greatly similar, but that is due to both of them being influenced largely by [Toriyama Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/AkiraToriyama)'s work growing up.

His former assistant was [Yoshikawa Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/98703/MikiYoshikawa) author of Yankee-kun to Megane-chan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/155544/)._
__Profile (Verygoo)__ | __Twitter__ __Shuuhei Mutsuki__ is a Japanese composer and orchestrator. He is also a music creator for the creative music unit (K)NoW_NAME.

name.native: アジアン・カンフー・ジェネレーション

node.description:
[Website](http://www.asiankung-fu.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AKG_information) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC52_sWDVAOwq5TaaA44kp-A)

Asian Kung-Fu Generation, stylized as ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION, is a Japanese alternative rock band formed in 1996.

Starting out as a college band, they released a series of independent EPs featuring lyrics mostly sung in English. In 2002, they released their major-label EP debut Hokai Amplifier, from that point singing their lyrics in Japanese. The band's musical style is influenced by seminal Western alternative rock acts as well as their own local Japanese indie-rock and punk scene. Their songs incorporate various aspects of the genres, most typically expressing fast tempos and prominent power chord guitar riffs in addition to rhythmic groove and emotional lyrics. Despite the indie nature of their music, the band has enjoyed worldwide commercial success in addition to critical acclaim.

They have also been cited as one of the best, most balanced modern rock bands to emerge from Japan in the '00s.

__Members:__
- [Masafumi Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/159934/) - vocalist
- [Kensuke Kita](https://anilist.co/staff/220702/) - guitarist
- [Takahiro Yamada](https://anilist.co/staff/159937/) - bassist
- [Kiyoshi Ijichi](https://anilist.co/staff/220703/) - drummer

(Source: Wikipedia)
Affiliated with Elephant (エレファント).
